column1: Table D1.18.21: Problems relating to mental health(a) managed by general practitioners, by Indigenous status of patient, April 2010–March 2015(b)
* Represents results with statistically significant differences in the Indigenous/Other comparisons at the p < 0.05 level.
n.p. Rates not calculated due to small number of events.
(a) Classified according to ICPC-2  (Classification Committee of the World Organisation of Family Doctors (WICC) 1998) and/or ICPC-2 PLUS codes.
(b) Data from five combined BEACH survey years April 2010–March 2011 to April 2014–March 2015 inclusive.
(c) Directly age-standardised rate (no. per 1,000 encounters) using total BEACH encounters in the period as the standard.
(d) 'Other' includes non-Indigenous patients and patients for whom Indigenous status was not stated.
(g) Rate ratio is the age-standardised rate for Indigenous Australians divided by the age-standardised rate for other Australians.
(h) Rate difference is the age-standardised rate for Indigenous Australians minus the age-standardised rate for other Australians.
Source: Analyses conducted by the Family Medicine Research Centre, University of Sydney, of BEACH data collected by that Centre.
